de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.selectable

Class SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation<DataType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<de.mrapp.android.util.view.ViewHolder>
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.enablestate.AbstractEnableStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
          • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.itemstate.AbstractItemStateListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
            • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.sortable.AbstractSortableListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
              • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.filterable.AbstractFilterableListAdapter<DataType,SelectableListDecorator<DataType>>
                • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.selectable.AbstractSelectableListAdapter<DataType>
                  • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.selectable.SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SortableListAdapter<DataType>, Loggable, RecyclerViewAdapter, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation<DataType>
extends AbstractSelectableListAdapter<DataType>
implements SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    An adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, of which only item can be selected at once. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ADAPT_SELECTION_AUTOMATICALLY_BUNDLE_KEY

        protected static final java.lang.String ADAPT_SELECTION_AUTOMATICALLY_BUNDLE_KEY
        The key, which is used to store, whether the adapter's selection is adapted automatically, or not, within a bundle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

        protected SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation(@NonNull
                                                android.content.Context context,
                                                @NonNull
                                                SelectableListDecorator<DataType> decorator,
                                                @NonNull
                                                de.mrapp.android.util.logging.LogLevel logLevel,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.ArrayList<Item<DataType>> items,
                                                boolean allowDuplicates,
                                                boolean notifyOnChange,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemClickListener<DataType>> itemClickListeners,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemLongClickListener<DataType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListAdapterListener<DataType>> adapterListeners,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListEnableStateListener<DataType>> enableStateListeners,
                                                int numberOfItemStates,
                                                boolean triggerItemStateOnClick,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListItemStateListener<DataType>> itemStateListeners,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListSortingListener<DataType>> sortingListeners,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListFilterListener<DataType>> filterListeners,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.LinkedHashSet<AppliedFilter<DataType>> appliedFilters,
                                                boolean selectItemOnClick,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.util.Set<ListSelectionListener<DataType>> selectionListeners,
                                                boolean adaptSelectionAutomatically)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, of which only one item can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        items - A list, which contains the the adapter's items, or an empty list, if the adapter should not contain any items
        allowDuplicates - True, if duplicate items should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified when the adapter's underlying data has been modified or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        enableStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified when an item has been disabled or enabled or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        numberOfItemStates - The number of states, the adapter's items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        triggerItemStateOnClick - True, if the state of an item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        itemStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the state of an item has been changed or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        sortingListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        filterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        appliedFilters - A set, which contains the filters, which should be used to filter the adapter's underlying data or an empty set, if the adapter's underlying data should not be filtered
        selectItemOnClick - True, if an item should be selected, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        selectionListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item's selection has been changed or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adaptSelectionAutomatically - True, if the adapter's selection should be adapted automatically, false otherwise

      • SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

        public SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation(@NonNull
                                             android.content.Context context,
                                             @NonNull
                                             SelectableListDecorator<DataType> decorator)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, of which only one item can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null

        public final int getSelectedIndex()
        Description copied from interface: SingleChoiceListAdapter
        Returns the index of the currently selected item.
        Specified by:
        getSelectedIndex in interface SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
        Returns:
        The index of the currently selected item, as an Integer value or -1, if no item is currently selected

      • getSelectedItem

        public final DataType getSelectedItem()
        Description copied from interface: SingleChoiceListAdapter
        Returns the currently selected item.
        Specified by:
        getSelectedItem in interface SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
        Returns:
        The currently selected item, as an instance of the generic type DataType or null, if no item is currently selected

      • triggerSelection

        public final boolean triggerSelection(int index)
        Description copied from interface: SingleChoiceListAdapter
        Triggers the selection of the item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected.
        Specified by:
        triggerSelection in interface SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose selection should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the given item has been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerSelection

        public final boolean triggerSelection(@NonNull
                                      DataType item)
        Description copied from interface: SingleChoiceListAdapter
        Triggers the selection of a specific item, if it is currently enabled. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected.
        Specified by:
        triggerSelection in interface SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be selected, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the given item has been changed, false otherwise

      • adaptSelectionAutomatically

        public final void adaptSelectionAutomatically(boolean adaptSelectionAutomatically)
        Description copied from interface: SingleChoiceListAdapter
        Sets, whether the adapter's selection should be automatically adapted in order to ensure that an item is always selected if possible, or not. For example this causes the selection to be adapted, when the currently selected item has been removed from the adapter.
        Specified by:
        adaptSelectionAutomatically in interface SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        adaptSelectionAutomatically - True, if the adapter's selection should be automatically adapted, false otherwise

      • isSelectionAdaptedAutomatically

        public final boolean isSelectionAdaptedAutomatically()
        Description copied from interface: SingleChoiceListAdapter
        Returns, whether the adapter's selection is automatically adapted in order to ensure that an item is always selected if possible, or not.
        Specified by:
        isSelectionAdaptedAutomatically in interface SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
        Returns:
        True, if the adapter's selection is automatically adapted, false otherwise
